channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: How to be a cricket fan when you're new to the sport
item.description: The U.S. men's team plays India in the T20 World Cup in suburban New York City. India advancing in the tournament is normal, but for the U.S. team it's unexpected. It has already beat Pakistan.

item.title: A major toy manufacturer is already nervous about Trump tariffs for holiday season
item.description: Jay Foreman, CEO of Basic Fun!, says the Trump administration's shifting tariff policy has created chaos for businesses — and could still disrupt the holiday season.

item.title: Why an economist says temporary U.S.-China tariff deal doesn't ease uncertainty
item.description: Businesses are rushing to import Chinese goods after the U.S. struck a temporary deal. This "stop-go" nature of trade could still mean higher prices and doesn't ease uncertainty, an economist warns.

item.title: This country is slowing climate action. Its capital city is stepping up
item.description: As many federal governments slow — or reverse — climate action, Austria's capital, Vienna, wants to show how cities can take the lead.

item.title: And the winner of the 2025 Tiny Desk Contest is...
item.description: NPR Music's Robin Hilton announces the name of this year's Tiny Desk Contest winner. Every year since 2015, a different unsigned musician or band has benefited from the exposure that NPR Music provides.

item.title: First, relief. Then, a scramble to get stuff in after U.S. cuts China tariffs for now
item.description: Although business owners welcomed a temporary deal with China to slash tariffs, there's still considerable uncertainty about what happens next.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Temporary trade deal between the U.S. and China sets off scramble to import goods, Trump arrives in Saudi Arabia with focus on business, trial of Sean "Diddy" Combs gets underway in New York City.

item.title: 5 Ukrainian women wounded in war appear in latest edition of Playboy
item.description: The latest issue of the Ukrainian edition of Playboy features female soldiers with amputated limbs and civilians scarred by shrapnel as beauty standards change in a society exhausted by war.

item.title: Trump signs executive order to reduce prescription drug prices
item.description: President Trump's latest executive order on drug prices aims to lower them by bringing them into line with what other developed countries pay. Experts caution that this is no small task.

item.title: Mother of 1-year-old girl among dozens of Cubans deported from Florida last month
item.description: A Florida family was torn apart when the mother of a 1-year old was deported to Cuba, even though she is married to an American citizen.
